title: Blog
content: Root (parent) for all blog pages on the site.

title: Markdown
content:
Examples of Markdown and corresponding output used on this site. The full Markdown syntax specification is available at . ([viewer](http://www.markdownviewer.com/)) This site uses the [python-markdown](http://www.freewisdom.org/projects/python-markdown/) implementation with the [tables](http://www.freewisdom.org/projects/python-markdown/Tables) and [table of contents](http://www.freewisdom.org/projects/python-markdown/Table_of_Contents) extras. ## Inline Element |Markdown | Output --------|------------|------------------------ Emphasis|`*Emphasis*`|*Emphasis* String |`**Strong**`|**Strong** Code |\`Code\` |`Code` Link |`[ahernp.com](http://ahernp.com "Ahern, Paul")`|[ahernp.com](http://ahernp.com "Ahern, Paul") Image |`![Paul Ahern](/media/img/ahernp200x200.png "Paul Ahern at Gougane Barra")`|![Paul Ahern](/media/img/ahernp200x200.png "Paul Ahern at Gougane Barra") Thumbnail|`[![Gougane](/media/img/thumb/Gougane.jpg "Church at Gougane Barra")](/media/img/Gougane.jpg)`|[![Gougane](/media/img/thumb/Gougane.jpg "Church at Gougane Barra")](/media/img/Gougane.jpg) Title |`# Title`|

Title

Heading|`## Heading`|

Heading

## Lists `* Item` * Item `1. Item` 1. Item ### Nested Indent each level by an additional 4 spaces. 1. Install package **numlockx**. 1. Setup Local LAMP server for development: 1. `sudo tasksel install lamp-server` 1. `sudo apt-get install phpmyadmin` 1. Install package **numlockx**. 1. Setup Local LAMP server for development: 1. `sudo tasksel install lamp-server` 1. `sudo apt-get install phpmyadmin` ## Block ### Code Indent by a tab or 4 spaces. ### Block Quote > In a hole in the ground there lived a hobbit. > Not a nasty damp smelly hole filled with the > ends of worms and things. Nor a dry sandy hole > with nothing in it to sit down on or eat. > This was a hobbit-hole and that means comfort. > In a hole in the ground there lived a hobbit. Not a nasty damp smelly hole filled with the > ends of worms and things. Nor a dry sandy hole with nothing in it to sit down on or eat. > This was a hobbit-hole and that means comfort. ### Tables Header 1 | Header 2 ---------|--------- Cell 1,1 | Cell 1,2 Cell 2,1 | Cell 2,2 Header 1 | Header 2 ---------|--------- Cell 1,1 | Cell 1,2 Cell 2,1 | Cell 2,2

title: ahernp.com
content:
## External

Favourite:
[Dictionary](http://dictionary.reference.com "Dictionary, Thesaurus, etc.")
[Isabelle](http://isabellebidou.com "Isabelle Bidou")
[StartPage](https://startpage.com/uk/? "Google Search Results, but with privacy")

Apps:
[Calibre](http://calibre-ebook.com/ "Ebook Manager")
[Geany](http://www.geany.org "Text editor")
[Inkscape](http://inkscape.org/ "SVG editor")
[LastPass](https://lastpass.com/ "Password Manager")

Books:
[ABE](http://www.abebooks.co.uk/ "Advanced Book Exchange")
[Amazon](http://www.amazon.co.uk/ "Amazon in the UK")
([read](http://read.amazon.com "Cloud Reader - Kindle Books"))
[Baen](http://www.baen.com/ "Baen book publisher")
[O'Reilly](http://oreilly.com/ebooks/ "IT Books")
[PG](http://www.gutenberg.org/ "Project Gutenberg")

Cartoons:
[Dilbert](http://www.dilbert.com "Today's Dilbert comic")
[Doonesbury](http://www.doonesbury.com "Today's Doonesbury comic")
[Garfield](http://www.garfield.com/comic "Today's Garfield comic")
[xkcd](http://xkcd.com/ "IT Comic")

Games:
[BOC](http://www.orienteering.ie/boc "Bishopstown Orienteering Club")
[GG](http://www.gamersgate.co.uk "GamersGate")
[GOG](http://www.gog.com/ "Good Old Games")
[Humble](https://www.humblebundle.com "Humble Indie Bundles")
[Steam](http://store.steampowered.com "Steam Shop")

Media:
[BBC](http://www.bbc.co.uk/weather/2643743?day=0 "BBC Weather")
[iPlayer](http://www.bbc.co.uk/iplayer/favourites)
[RT](http://www.radiotimes.com/radio/radio-listings "Radio Times")
[Revolutions](http://www.revolutionspodcast.com/ "by Mike Duncan")
[YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/feed/subscriptions)

Misc:
[AE](http://academicearth.org "Academic Earth lectures")
[gov.uk](https://www.gov.uk/bank-holidays "UK Bank Holidays")
[Map](http://www.openstreetmap.org/)
[MPS](http://www.mpsonline.org.uk "Mail and Telephone preference service")
[Radar](http://www.metoffice.gov.uk/public/weather/observation/rainfall-radar#?map=Rainfall&fcTime=1465248600&zoom=9&lon=-0.43&lat=51.34 "London rainfall radar")
[TfL](http://www.tfl.gov.uk/tube-dlr-overground/status/ "London Underground Status")
[Walks](http://www.walks.com/ "Guided walks in London")


Shopping:
[Allwrite](http://www.allwrite.nl/ "Pens")
[BM](http://www.britishmuseum.org/ "The British Museum")
[M&S](http://www.marksandspencer.com "Marks and Spencer")
[Senz](http://www.senzumbrellas.com/ "Umbrellas")

Social:
[Contacts](https://www.google.com/contacts "Useful section Google don't provide a link to")
[Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/ahernp2 "My Profile on Facebook")
[LinkedIn](https://www.linkedin.com/in/ahernp "My Profile on LinkedIn")
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/ahernp "My Profile on Twitter")

This Site:
[Angular](https://angular.io/docs/ts/latest/ "Angular 2 with Typescript")
[Django](http://www.djangoproject.com/ "Web development framework")
[GitHub](https://github.com/ahernp/angular-django)

Web:
[CSS](http://www.cookwood.com/ "HTML & Cascading Style Sheets")
[Gibson](http://grc.com/default.htm "PC security checks")
[PyPI](https://pypi.python.org/pypi "Python Package Index")
[W3Schools](http://w3schools.com/ "Web standards")
